meanings.definition: To turn something into a commodity for sale.
meanings.sent1: She decided to commodify her handmade crafts by selling them at the market.
meanings.sent2: In today's society, many artists commodify their work to make a living.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commodifying her time to earn money seemed strange at first.
meanings.sent4: He had a unique talent for commodifying even the simplest objects into valuable items.
meanings.sent5: The process of commodifying goods has been a common practice for centuries.

meanings.definition: To treat something as a commodity.
meanings.sent1: The company chose to commodify the environment, focusing solely on profits.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to commodify human relationships, as they are priceless.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would commodify her cat if it meant making a profit.
meanings.sent4: The film industry tends to commodify emotions, turning them into entertainment.
meanings.sent5: He realized he had unintentionally commodified his passion for painting.
